jyVis.visualizationPrimitives
Class Axis

java.lang.Object
  jyVis.visualizationPrimitives.VisualizationPrimitive
      jyVis.visualizationPrimitives.Line
          jyVis.visualizationPrimitives.Axis

public class Axis
extends Line

A generic axis. All fields which define this axis are exposed as public fields. After they are modified, calculateAxis() should be called.

Author:
Curran Kelleher

Field Summary

          The dimension in the dataset that this axis uses

public int numMajorTickMarks
The number of major tick marks

public int numMinorTickMarks
The number of minor tick marks between major tick marks

The length of the major tick marks

The length of the minor tick marks

The offset of the tick marks (their distance away from the axis)

public double numberSize
The size of the numbers

numSpacingFactor

public double numSpacingFactor
factor that determines the number spacing relative to the tick mark spacing

numberOffset

public double numberOffset
The offset of the numbers (their distance away from the axis)

numberFormatString

public java.lang.String numberFormatString
The string used for number formatting (see Javas DecimalFormat)

normalization

public Normalization normalization
The normalization used to generate the numbers to display along this axis

dimension

public int dimension
The dimension in the dataset that this axis uses

label

public TextLabel label
The title label for this axis. The x, y, and theta fields of this JVTextLabel are reset when this axis gets painted, to be in synch with titleX, titleY, and titleTheta (defined in this axis), therefore modifying them manually does nothing.

labelX

public double labelX
The position of the title along the X-axis of this axis. In this context, the X-axis refers to the lengthwise direction: 0 on the X-axis corresponds to the first point of this axis (x1,y1), 1 on the X-axis corresponds to the second point of this axis (x2,y2).

labelY

public double labelY
The position of the title along the Y-axis of this axis. In this context, the Y-axis refers to the widthwise direction: 0 on the Y-axis corresponds to a point on the line of this axis, 1 on the Y-axis corresponds to a point 1 unit (in the coordinate space) away from the line of this axis.

labelRotation

public double labelRotation
The rotation in degrees of the label of this axis, in the clockwise direction, about the point (titleX,titleY). This is 0 by default. This rotation is in addition to the rotation which aligns the text with the label, which is always performed.

numbersRotation

public double numbersRotation
The rotation of all numbers on this axis

numbersXAlignment

public java.lang.String numbersXAlignment
The x alignment of the numbers - either CENTER, LEFT, or RIGHT

numbersYAlignment

public java.lang.String numbersYAlignment
The y alignment of the numbers - either CENTER, BOTTOM, or TOP

visible

public boolean visible
A flag indicating whether or not to draw the axis. If this is false, the axis will not be drawn. (true by default)

Parameters:
x1 - the x of the start point
y1 - the y of the start point
x2 - the x of the end point
y2 - the y of the end point
Method Detail

calculateAxis

public void calculateAxis()
Calculates all attributes of the axis. This means the tick marks and the title text label. This method has a side effect on the normalization, it sets its output range to be (0,1) so the normalization performs correct inverse calculations.

computeWindowTransformation

public void computeWindowTransformation(Window2D w)
Calculates the pixel-space points that this object will need when drawing and testing for selections.

Overrides:
computeWindowTransformation in class Line
Parameters:
w - the window to use for coordinate-space to pixel-space transformations.

paint

public void paint(java.awt.Graphics g,
                  Window2D w)
Draws this object, using the transformation information calculated in computeWindowTransformation().

Overrides:
paint in class Line
Parameters:
g - the Graphics to draw this object on
w - the window to use for coordinate-space to pixel-space transformations.
